import React from 'react'; import SignBridge1 from './images/signbridge.png'; import SignBridge2 from './images/signbridge2.png'; import SignBridge3 from './images/signbridge3.png'; import SignBridgeLogo from './images/signbridgelogo.png'; import './SignBridge.css'; function SignBridge() { return (
{/* First Section */}

Introducing Sign Bridge

Sign Bridge is a Python-based American Sign Language (ASL) learning app, designed to bridge the communication gap between the deaf and hearing communities.

Integrated with a real-time sign language recognition model, Sign Bridge provides interactive learning with instant feedback via a webcam quiz feature.

{/* Second Section */}

The Inspiration

As a developer passionate about accessibility, I recognized the need to help bridge the gap in communication between hearing and deaf individuals. This led to the creation of Sign Bridge — a tool to learn ASL and foster inclusivity.

{/* Third Section */}

Breaking Barriers

Sign language isn’t just a tool for the deaf. It’s a universal language that everyone can learn and use. Sign Bridge helps promote the idea that sign language is a vibrant culture, not just a necessity for a specific group of people.

{/* Fourth Section */}

A Step Toward Inclusivity

Sign Bridge isn’t just an app — it’s a movement to integrate ASL into everyday communication, making the world more inclusive and accessible for all.

); } export default SignBridge;
